Great game. Normally the comedy aspect of games end up being stupid and pointless but I feel like there were funny little scenes placed throughout the cutscenes that actually made it funny and it didn't look stupid. The gameplay was great; challenging but not impossible and the whole game didn't take forever to beat. Great game to play especially if you like puzzles so give it a try because I had a blast!
Muy buena la historia,muy bueno el coop.,los graficos,la jugabilidad excelente,ME ENCANTA
If you don't like this game, then you probably don't have a soul.

I found the game okay. The co- op doesn't feel last minute crammed and enjoyed a good challange with a freind or with a ranom stranger, but there is not much to a story line to it just that you were put there. The single player story line mode with going on with the same person. I thought that was a good move like most games do. You have a less lonely feeling and the puzzles you could actaully get use to. I loved replaying the game and feelings for the game didn't change much second time around. You could feel the creativy and planning they put in the game and the game gives a new feeling replacing the feeling of lonelyness but you feel betrayed at one point in the game and something bigger you have to handle, Challange. The game was somewhat challanging and the story line actaully enjoyed and wasn't confused, on the sort of joke they were going for. The diffcultly of the game wasn't too much of a hassle but wasn't a stroll through the park. You have more to work with in the game publishing tool given and expan your creativity and see others great works of levels. Planning and helps with future game developers in the genre of platforming or puzzles to practice to get down basics to understand how to make there games better or to place objects and surroundings and  to help visally or if you just want to exersice your brains creatvity and learning.
Best puzzle game for me. BTW add linux support please?

I absolutely recommend this game if you like puzzles. This has to be one of the greatest logic games out there; if it's not, then that says something pretty good about the puzzle game industry. The levels get increasingly complex and difficult while introducing new and fun ways to get to the next chamber. You also have good graphics, an interesting story-line, and HILARIOUS dialogue. Two thumbs up, all the way.

Portal 2, Portal 2 hmm what can i say about this game called Portal 2,

It is single handedly one of the greatest games I have ever played of all time it is in my top 5 games of the 21st century, It has one of the most amazingly funny scripts and had me in stiches from the get go. GLaDOS is back to her murderous sadistic ways even as a potato (SPOILERS) . WIthout spoiling the plot, I think that the story is just pure genius from start to finish and has some unforgettably brillant voice actors from Ellen mclain to the delightful Stephen Merchant to the crazy J.K Simmons this game has it all. I cannot stress how much you all need to play this game before you kick the bucket.

amazing game in every aspect, especially for players of Portal 1. Storyline, design, visuals, immersion. Only criticism is that it lacks replayability and despite being longer than the original it still feels a LITTLE too short, you can complete the single player in around 8 hours or less. However the replayability is not an issue because of the community-level building initiative, which is pretty genius.

One of the greatest games of all time. This is as much a puzzle game as it is an enticing narrative, where you, the player, make it all happen. It's beautifully written and designed. When you get stuck in the game, it's not because the environment or game engine is cheating you, it's because you aren't thinking with portals!

I played this game because I had played the first one, loved it, and was anxiously awaiting its sequel. Admittedly, the first time I played Portal 2 was via a cracked copy. However, I wanted to play it again so badly, and determined the developers deserved my money, that I decided to pick it up. My girlfriend and I both enjoy the hell out of the Portal series, and the native controller integration means we can both game off my rig from the couch! 10/10! 

Also, I was just recently made aware of this: there is a very beautifully designed map editor built right into the game, where you can help yourself to a myriad of highly rated maps, and design your own. It's not for the faint of heart, as the thought process that goes into designing a map is not the same one that goes into solving it. But it's very useful if, like me, you have a very young sister-in-law who wants to play your game, but the standard maps are too hard for her.

“When life gives you lemons, don’t make lemonade. Make life take the lemons back! Get mad! I don’t want your damn lemons, what the hell am I supposed to do with these? Demand to see life’s manager! Make life rue the day it thought it could give Cave Johnson lemons! Do you know who I am? I’m the man who’s gonna burn your house down! With the lemons! I’m gonna get my engineers to invent a combustible lemon that burns your house down!”

9.8/10

This game is good.  You use your Mind (another name for brain in case you had no idea of what that was).  It is educational so you can yell very loudly to people that you are smarts.  You can build your own maps and test them for funs.  You can also shoot portals from a device called a Portal Gun.  Spoiler Alert you shoot portals and go through them. GAME=FUNS                                                RECOMMENDED BY ME

I played this game cracked and ended up buying it. You have a very good time with the story mode, then you have the workshop if you want to play more (some maps are really well designed).

This game is also compatible with the Hydra (from Sixense), it allows you to play with motion control, super fun!
